original_issue.title: Azure Function timeout error
original_issue.description: Function keeps timing out after 30 seconds

original_issue.title: Deep dive demo of the new Planner & Roadmap
original_issue.description:
There are over 900 project managers at the City of Montreal.
Currently, they are testing PP3 and PP5. Although I have explained the minor differences between the two licenses, the client is requesting a detailed presentation outlining the specific advantages and distinctions of both products. They want a clear, comprehensive comparison focused on these differences.
original_issue.impact:
At this point, I sent the following information:
Subsequently, we initiated discussions with Alithya, Microsoft's dedicated partner for Project Portfolio (PP) and Project Online (PO).
Ultimately, before moving forward, the client wants to understand the differences. Once that is clarified, they will begin discussions with the partner.

system_analysis.context_summary: This appears to be a product roadmap issue with user roadmap inquiry with medium business impact.

corrections.correction_notes: In this case Roadmap is a product.  If you evaluate the Description you will see that the words Planner and Roadmap are products from modern work.

original_issue.title: ESS Customer Interest - Johnson Controls
original_issue.description: Need to enroll Johnson Controls to the ESS Customer interest form in order to get them started in Employee Self Service Agent.  Customer is trying to deploy ESS and configure it with Service Now, and Workday. wants to displace Moveworks
original_issue.impact: High risk of increased vendor consolidation with Moveworks. currently customer HR department is using it with workday, service now, and an lms platform.

system_analysis.context_summary: This appears to be a feature enhancement issue with user configuration help with medium business impact.

step_by_step: üîë Step 7: Key Concept and Keyword Analysis
üìà Step 8: Business Impact and Complexity Assessment

data_sources_used.reason: External knowledge source for Microsoft product information
data_sources_used.note: Used for product disambiguation and context

corrections.correction_notes: ESS is a product called Employee Self Service.  It is where employees can change their passwords and do other maintenance items without assistance from IT.  The customer wants to use this process.  There really is no technical ask here but we would probably consider it a integration or security issue.

original_issue.title: SCOM support Linux Roadmap/confidence call with PG
original_issue.description:
The context : during the last months, customer had difficulties with integrating the latest Linux OS flavors within SCOM. There are typically two recent stories behind this : 

  

Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9.5 was published Generally Available in November 2024, but wasn't supported within SCOM until a few months after ‚Äì with the impact for us that we had to wait way too long before being able to offer it to our customers 
We also had a poor experience with Microsoft Support, which stated that Ubuntu 24.04 was not supported within our version of SCOM, which in fact was the case ‚Äì with the impact for us that we were left with doubts on what's true or false 
The perception with the new OS integration in SCOM in our company could be summarized as follows : 

  

When a new Windows Server OS is released, the integration in SCOM of this new OS is seamless, we have literally nothing to do 
When a new Linux OS is released, the integration in SCOM is most of the time painful, it takes us hours of dealing with OpenSSL or TLS version mismatches, adjusting sudoers, deciphering cryptic error messages in the SCOM Discovery Wizard, spending time on creating Microsoft Support requests  
  

Swatch Group is considering moving Linux monitoring workflows out of SCOM.
original_issue.impact: If the solution is not provided the customer considers to move away from SCOM.

system_analysis.context_summary: This appears to be a training and documentation issue with user reporting an issue with low business impact.

step_by_step: üîë Step 7: Key Concept and Keyword Analysis
üìà Step 8: Business Impact and Complexity Assessment

microsoft_products.name: roadmap
microsoft_products.title: Microsoft Roadmap - Project roadmap management
microsoft_products.description: Microsoft Roadmap provides visual representation of project timelines and milestones. It's part of the Microsoft Project suite for enterprise project management and planning. Roadmap helps teams track project progress and communicate timelines.

final_analysis.category_reason: Detected Microsoft products (['roadmap']) in training/demo context

decision_factors: ‚úÖ Microsoft product detection + training context = Documentation request

corrections.correction_notes: Roadmap refers to WHEN SCOM will be supported by Linux. The user also wants a confidence call from someone in the PG and can confirm the roadmap (plan) of when it will be available.
